title: Koozie Group, IMAGEN Brands Donate Over $782,000 in 2022 - Advertising Specialty Institute
summary: Koozie Group and IMAGEN Brands released their 2022 Keep It. Give It. annual corporate social responsibility report detailing over $782,000 in charitable donations, progress on their goal to become carbon neutral on Scope 1 and Scope 2 emissions by the end of 2024, and reaching affiliation with the Fair Labor Association. The report highlights the company's commitment to giving back to employees and community, safety and social responsibility, and environmental stewardship.

title: Koch Industries Earns 2023 ENERGY STAR Partner of the Year Award for Energy Management - PR Newswire
summary: Koch Industries has won the EPA's ENERGY STAR® Partner of the Year Award for 2023, the third consecutive year Koch has earned this award. Koch employees work to use fewer resources as they create products that help people improve their lives. Koch has invested more than $1.8 billion in energy efficiency projects across its more than 300 U.S.-based facilities throughout the last decade.
green_innovation: TRUE, Koch Industries has implemented energy efficiency projects and invested in renewable energy, reducing energy consumption and emissions.
business_innovation: TRUE, Koch Industries has implemented data, artificial intelligence, process control and cloud technology in managing its manufacturing assets and process health, optimizing operations and improving energy management.
green_product: TRUE, Koch Industries has invested in a 45-megawatt supplemental solar power plant with more than 100,000 panels for Flint Hills' Pine Bend refinery, increasing the refinery's efficiency by generating enough energy to power 6,500 homes annually.
green_process: TRUE, Koch Industries has invested in a Combined Heat and Power (CHP) system, which generates 70% of the facility's power needs from highly efficient on-site energy generation.
product_or_process: DEPCOM Power, CHP system, Collaboration and Support Center (CSC)

title: Revisiting Circular Economy in 2023 - United Nations Development Programme
summary: The UNDP is supporting local initiatives in Fiji to tackle plastic pollution by promoting circular economies and reducing plastic waste. Circular economy models aim to reduce environmental impact and increase efficiency through reuse, repair, and recycling. Fiji's Nausori Town Council is implementing circular economy strategies in waste management, education, and regulation to reduce plastic waste.

title: What you need to know about the Species Recovery Programme Capital Grant scheme - Natural England
summary: The Species Recovery Programme Capital Grant Scheme (SRPCGS) is a two-year grant scheme that provides funding for projects that focus on action for Priority, Threatened, or Near Threatened species contributing to the Environment Act target to reduce the risk of extinction. Projects must include the enhancement or creation of a capital asset, such as habitat enhancement and/or creation works, purchase and installation of new site infrastructure, or conservation translocations. The scheme can fund eligible works on privately or publicly owned land for which the grant recipient has “management control”.
